page.title: 07St. George's School
page.content: St. George's School in Reforne stands today almost unchanged since its opening on April 6th, 1857. Constructed at a cost of Â£775, the building has for 112 years educated in its classroom many thousands of the islands children until it was closed in 1969 and left vacant. In December 1981, the Island of Portland Heritage Trust was formed and, within three months, had raised the Â£25,000 needed to purchase the building. The Trust, in conjunction with the West Country Tourist Board, have now opened the islands first information centre to encourage visitors to appreciate both the wild-life and the natural beauty of the landscape of the island. It is planned that St. George's Centre will act as a focus and resource base for all forms of community activity and interest.
